member.name: T:Sharkbite.Irc.CtcpListener
member.summary: This class is used to send CTCP specific events. Once registered with this object the client can receive notification of all CTCP requests, pings, and replies. Instances of this class are not created directly but are retrieved as a property from a object.
member.remarks: All CTCP messages come in Request/Reply pairs. Each event signals either the Request or the Response. All CTCP queries (with the exception of CTCP Ping) are very similiar so they are all handled by the same set of events.

member.param: The connection to the IRC server.

member.param: The raw message from the IRC server
member.returns: True if this is a Ctcp request or reply.

member.name: T:Sharkbite.Irc.CtcpSender
member.summary:
This class allows the client to send CTCP commands. There is no limit on what commands can actually be sent, however, the accepted CTCP commands are: UserInfo, Finger, Version, Source, ClientInfo, ErrMsg, and Time.
Action, though it is also a CTCP command, is so common that it is handled by the normal sender class.

member.name: M:Sharkbite.Irc.DccChatSession.Accept(Sharkbite.Irc.DccUserInfo)
member.summary: When another a remote user has sent a chat request, this method is called to accept the request and start a chat session with that user.
member.remarks: This method should be called from within a try/catch block because there are many things that could prevent this connection attempt from succeeding.
member.param: A collection of information about the remote user.
member.returns: The DccChatSession instance for this session.

member.name: M:Sharkbite.Irc.DccChatSession.Request(Sharkbite.Irc.DccUserInfo,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Send a DCC Chat request to a remote user and use the default timeout period of 30 seconds.

remarks.para: If the user does not respond within the timeout period the DccChatSession will stop listening for a connection. The sesssion instance created then becomes invalid. This methods must be called again and a new instance created in order to initiate a try again.
This method should be called from within a try/catch block in case there are socket errors.

member.param: A collection of information about the remote user.

The IP address of the local machine in dot quad format (e.g. 192.168.0.25). This is the address that will be sent to the remote user. The IP address of the NAT machine must be used if the client is behind a a NAT/Firewall system.
The TCP/IP port to listen on

member.name: M:Sharkbite.Irc.DccChatSession.Request(Sharkbite.Irc.DccUserInfo,System.String,System.Int32,System.Int64)
member.summary: Send a DCC Chat request to a remote user and wait for a connection using timeout period specified.

remarks.para: If the user does not respond within the timeout period the DccChatSession will stop listening for a connection. The sesssion instance created then becomes invalid. This methods must be called again and a new instance created in order to initiate a try again.
This method should be called from within a try/catch block in case there are socket errors.

member.param: A collection of information about the remote user.

The IP address that will be sent to the remote user. It must be in dotted quad format (i.e. 192.168.0.2). If the client is behind a NAT system then this should be the address of that system and not the local host.
The TCP/IP port to listen on
How long to wait for a response in milliseconds. A value of zero will disable the timeout.

member.summary:
Determine whether the acks sent during an upload signal that all bytes have been sent.
BitchX sends bad acks after a resume but we can catch that by testing for the same ack sent twice. I sure hope others behave better since I don't want to write special code for every IRC client.

member.summary: Ask a remote user to send a file. The remote user may or may not respond and there is no fixed time within which he must respond. A response will come in the form of a DCC Send request.
member.param: The connection the remotes user is on.
Who to send the request to.
The name of the file to have sent. This should not contain any spaces.
True to use send-ahead mode for transfers.

member.name: M:Sharkbite.Irc.DccFileSession.Send(Sharkbite.Irc.DccUserInfo,System.String,System.Int32,Sharkbite.Irc.DccFileInfo,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Attempt to send a file to a remote user. Start listening on the given port and address. If the remote user does not accept the offer within the timeout period the the session will be closed.
member.remarks: This method should be called from within a try/catch block in case there are socket errors. This methods will also automatically handle a Resume if the remote client requests it.
member.param: The information about the remote user.

The IP address of the local machine in dot quad format (e.g. 192.168.0.25). This is the address that will be sent to the remote user. The IP address of the NAT machine must be used if the client is behind a NAT/Firewall system.
The port that the session will listen on.
The file to be sent. If the file name has spaces in it they will be replaced with underscores when the name is sent.
The size of the send buffer. Generally should be between 4k and 32k.
True to use send-ahead mode for transfers.
member.returns: A unique session instance for this file and remote user.
member.exception: If the listen port is already in use.

member.name: M:Sharkbite.Irc.DccFileSession.Receive(Sharkbite.Irc.DccUserInfo,Sharkbite.Irc.DccFileInfo,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Another user has offered to send a file. This method should be called to accept the offer and save the file to the give location. The parameters needed to call this method are provided by the OnDccFileTransferRequest() event.
member.remarks: This method should be called from within a try/catch block in case it is unable to connect or there are other socket errors.
member.param: Information on the remote user.
The local file that will hold the data being sent. If the file is the result of a previous incomplete download the the attempt will be made to resume where the previous left off.
Will the send ahead protocol be used.
member.returns: A unique session instance for this file and remote user.
member.exception: If the listen port is already in use.

member.name: T:Sharkbite.Irc.Sender
member.summary: This class is used to send all the IRC commands except for CTCP and DCC messages. Instances of this class are retrieved as properties of the Connection object. All methods in this class are thread safe.

remarks.para: Due to the asynchronous nature of IRC, none of these commands have a return value. To get that value (or possibly an error) the client must handle the corresponding event. For example, to check if a user is online the client would send then check the value of the event to receive the answer.

When a command can return an error, the possible error replies are listed. An error message will be sent via the event with one of the listed error codes as a parameter. When checking for these errors use the constants from .
The maximum length of any command string sent to the server is 512 characters.

member.name: M:Sharkbite.Irc.Sender.Quit(System.String)
member.summary: A client session is terminated with a quit message.

remarks.para: The server acknowledges this by sending an ERROR message to the client.
Before closing the Connection with the IRC server this method will call Listener.beforeDisconnect() and after the Connection is closed it will call Listener.OnDisconnect()

member.param: Reason for quitting.

member.summary: User registration consists of 3 commands: 1. PASS 2. NICK 3. USER Pass will rarely fail but the proposed Nick might already be taken in which case the client will have to register by manually calling Nick and User.

member.name: M:Sharkbite.Irc.Sender.Join(System.String)
member.summary: Join the specified channel.
member.remarks:
Once a user has joined a channel, he receives information about all commands his server receives affecting the channel. This includes JOIN, MODE, KICK, PART, QUIT and of course PRIVMSG/NOTICE. This allows channel members to keep track of the other channel members, as well as channel modes.
If a JOIN is successful, the user receives a JOIN message as confirmation and is then sent the channel's topic ( and the list of users who are on the channel ( ), which MUST include the user joining.
Possible Errors
ERR_NEEDMOREPARAMS
ERR_BANNEDFROMCHAN
ERR_INVITEONLYCHAN
ERR_BADCHANNELKEY
ERR_CHANNELISFULL
ERR_BADCHANMASK
ERR_NOSUCHCHANNEL
ERR_TOOMANYCHANNELS
ERR_TOOMANYTARGETS
ERR_UNAVAILRESOURCE
member.param: The channel to join. Channel names must begin with '&', '#', '+' or '!'.
member.exception: If the channel name is not valid.

member.summary: Join a passworded channel.
member.param: Channel to join
The channel's pasword. Cannot be null or empty.
member.exception: If the channel name is not valid or the password is null.

member.name: M:Sharkbite.Irc.Sender.PublicNotice(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Send a notice to a channel.

remarks.para: The difference between a notice and a normal message is that automatic replies must never be sent in response to a notice. This rule applies to servers too - they must not send any error reply back to the client on receipt of a notice. The object of this rule is to avoid loops between clients automatically sending something in response to something it received. See for possible errors.

member.param: The target channel.
Text message. If the text is too large to be sent in one piece it will be broken up into smaller strings which will then be sent individually.
member.exception: If the channel name is not valid or the message is empty or null.

member.name: M:Sharkbite.Irc.Sender.PrivateNotice(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Send a notice to a user.

remarks.para: The difference between a notice and a normal message is that automatic replies must never be sent in response to a notice. This rule applies to servers too - they must not send any error reply back to the client on receipt of a notice. The object of this rule is to avoid loops between clients automatically sending something in response to something it received. See for possible errors.

member.param: The target nickname.
Text message. If the text is too large to be sent in one piece it will be broken up into smaller strings which will then be sent individually.
member.exception: If the nick is not valid or the message is empty or null.

member.name: M:Sharkbite.Irc.Sender.Invite(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Invite a user to a channel.
member.remarks:
The parameter nickname is the nickname of the person to be invited to the target channel channel. There is no requirement that the channel the target user is being invited to must exist or be a valid channel. However, if the channel exists, only members of the channel are allowed to invite other users. When the channel has invite-only flag set, only channel operators may an invite.
Only the user inviting and the user being invited will receive notification of the invitation. Other channel members are not notified. (This is unlike the mode changes, and is occasionally the source of trouble for users.)
After the invite is sent the IRC server will signal that it was correctly received by calling .
Possible Errors
ERR_NEEDMOREPARAMS
ERR_NOSUCHNICK
ERR_NOTONCHANNEL
ERR_USERONCHANNEL
ERR_CHANOPRIVSNEEDED
member.param: The nick of the person to invite
The channel they are invited to join.
member.exception: If the nickname or channel is not valid.

member.name: T:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode
member.summary: Numeric message codes taken from RFC 2812

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.RPL_WELCOME
member.summary: IRC: Welcome to the Internet Relay Networ [nick]![user]@[host]

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.RPL_YOURHOST
member.summary: IRC: Your host is [servername], running version [ver]

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.RPL_CREATED
member.summary: IRC: This server was created [date]

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.RPL_MYINFO
member.summary:
IRC: [servername] [version] [available user modes [available channel modes]
Description: The server sends Replies 001 to 004 to a user upon successful registration.

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.RPL_BOUNCE
member.summary:
IRC: Try server [server name], port [port number]
Description: Sent by the server to a user to suggest an alternative server. This is often used when the connection is refused because the server is already full.

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.RPL_USERHOST
member.summary:
IRC: :*1[reply] *( " " [reply] )
Description: Reply format used by USERHOST to list replies to the query list. The reply string is composed as follows: reply = nickname [ "*" ] "=" ( "+" / "-" ) hostname The '*' indicates whether the client has registered as an Operator. The '-' or '+' characters represent whether the client has set an AWAY message or not respectively.

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.RPL_ISON
member.summary:
IRC: :*1[nick] *( " " [nick] )
Description: Reply format used by ISON to list replies to the query list.

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.RPL_AWAY
member.summary: IRC: [nick] :[away message]

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.RPL_UNAWAY
member.summary: IRC: :You are no longer marked as being away

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.RPL_NOWAWAY
member.summary:
IRC: :You have been marked as being away
Description: These replies are used with the AWAY command (if allowed). RPL_AWAY is sent to any client sending a PRIVMSG to a client which is away. RPL_AWAY is only sent by the server to which the client is connected. Replies RPL_UNAWAY and RPL_NOWAWAY are sent when the client removes and sets an AWAY message.

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.RPL_WHOISUSER
member.summary: IRC: [nick] [user] [host] * :[real name]

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.RPL_WHOISSERVER
member.summary: IRC: [nick] [server] :[server info]

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.RPL_WHOISOPERATOR
member.summary: IRC: [nick] :is an IRC operator

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.RPL_WHOISIDLE
member.summary: IRC: [nick] [integer] :seconds idle

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.RPL_ENDOFWHOIS
member.summary: IRC: [nick] :End of WHOIS list

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.RPL_WHOISCHANNELS
member.summary:
IRC: [nick] :*( ( "@" / "+" ) [channel] " " )
Description: Replies 311 - 313, 317 - 319 are all replies generated in response to a WHOIS message. Given that there are enough parameters present, the answering server MUST either formulate a reply out of the above numerics (if the query nick is found) or return an error reply. The '*' in RPL_WHOISUSER is there as the literal character and not as a wild card. For each reply set, only RPL_WHOISCHANNELS may appear more than once (for long lists of channel names). The '@' and '+' characters next to the channel name indicate whether a client is a channel operator or has been granted permission to speak on a moderated channel. The RPL_ENDOFWHOIS reply is used to mark the end of processing a WHOIS message.

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.RPL_WHOWASUSER
member.summary: IRC: [nick] [user] [host] * :[real name]

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.RPL_ENDOFWHOWAS
member.summary:
IRC: [nick] :End of WHOWAS
Description: When replying to a WHOWAS message, a server MUST use the replies RPL_WHOWASUSER, RPL_WHOISSERVER or ERR_WASNOSUCHNICK for each nickname in the presented list. At the end of all reply batches, there MUST be RPL_ENDOFWHOWAS (even if there was only one reply and it was an error).

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.RPL_LISTSTART
member.summary: Description: Obsolete. Not used.

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.RPL_LIST
member.summary: IRC: [channel] [# visible] :[topic]

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.RPL_LISTEND
member.summary:
IRC: :End of LIST
Description: Replies RPL_LIST, RPL_LISTEND mark the actual replies with data and end of the server's response to a LIST command. If there are no channels available to return, only the end reply MUST be sent.

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.RPL_UNIQOPIS
member.summary: IRC: [channel] [nickname]

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.RPL_CHANNELMODEIS
member.summary: IRC: [channel] [mode] [mode params]

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.RPL_NOTOPIC
member.summary: IRC: [channel] :No topic is set

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.RPL_TOPIC
member.summary:
IRC: [channel] :[topic]
Description: When sending a TOPIC message to determine the channel topic, one of two replies is sent. If the topic is set, RPL_TOPIC is sent back else RPL_NOTOPIC.

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.RPL_INVITING
member.summary:
IRC: [channel] [nick]
Description: Returned by the server to indicate that the attempted INVITE message was successful and is being passed onto the end client.

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.RPL_SUMMONING
member.summary:
IRC: [user] :Summoning user to IRC
Description: Returned by a server answering a SUMMON message to indicate that it is summoning that user.

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.RPL_INVITELIST
member.summary: IRC: [channel] [invitemask]

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.RPL_ENDOFINVITELIST
member.summary:
IRC: [channel] :End of channel invite list
Description: When listing the 'invitations masks' for a given channel, a server is required to send the list back using the RPL_INVITELIST and RPL_ENDOFINVITELIST messages. A separate RPL_INVITELIST is sent for each active mask. After the masks have been listed (or if none present) a RPL_ENDOFINVITELIST MUST be sent.

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.RPL_EXCEPTLIST
member.summary: IRC: [channel] [exceptionmask]

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.RPL_ENDOFEXCEPTLIST
member.summary:
IRC: [channel] :End of channel exception list
Description: When listing the 'exception masks' for a given channel, a server is required to send the list back using the RPL_EXCEPTLIST and RPL_ENDOFEXCEPTLIST messages. A separate RPL_EXCEPTLIST is sent for each active mask. After the masks have been listed (or if none present) a RPL_ENDOFEXCEPTLIST MUST be sent.

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.RPL_VERSION
member.summary:
IRC: [version].[debuglevel] [server] :[comments]
Description: Reply by the server showing its version details. The [version] is the version of the software being used (including any patchlevel revisions) and the [debuglevel] is used to indicate if the server is running in "debug mode". The "comments" field may contain any comments about the version or further version details.

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.RPL_WHOREPLY
member.summary: IRC: [channel] [user] [host] [server] [nick ( "H" / "G" ] ["*"] [ ( "@" / "+" ) :[hopcount] [real name]

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.RPL_ENDOFWHO
member.summary:
IRC: [name] :End of WHO list
Description: The RPL_WHOREPLY and RPL_ENDOFWHO pair are used to answer a WHO message. The RPL_WHOREPLY is only sent if there is an appropriate match to the WHO query. If there is a list of parameters supplied with a WHO message, a RPL_ENDOFWHO MUST be sent after processing each list item with [name] being the item.

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.RPL_NAMREPLY
member.summary:
IRC: ( "=" / "*" / "@" ) [channel :[ "@" / "+" ] [nick] *( " " [ "@" / "+" ] [nick]
Description: "@" is used for secret channels, "*" for private channels, and "=" for others (public channels).

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.RPL_ENDOFNAMES
member.summary:
IRC: [channel] :End of NAMES list
Description: To reply to a NAMES message, a reply pair consisting of RPL_NAMREPLY and RPL_ENDOFNAMES is sent by the server back to the client. If there is no channel found as in the query, then only RPL_ENDOFNAMES is returned. The exception to this is when a NAMES message is sent with no parameters and all visible channels and contents are sent back in a series of RPL_NAMEREPLY messages with a RPL_ENDOFNAMES to mark the end.

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.RPL_LINKS
member.summary: IRC: [mask] [server] :[hopcount] [server info]

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.RPL_ENDOFLINKS
member.summary:
IRC: [mask] :End of LINKS list
Description: In replying to the LINKS message, a server MUST send replies back using the RPL_LINKS numeric and mark the end of the list using an RPL_ENDOFLINKS reply.

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.RPL_BANLIST
member.summary: IRC: [channel] [banmask]

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.RPL_ENDOFBANLIST
member.summary:
IRC: [channel] :End of channel ban list
Description: When listing the active 'bans' for a given channel, a server is required to send the list back using the RPL_BANLIST and RPL_ENDOFBANLIST messages. A separate RPL_BANLIST is sent for each active banmask. After the banmasks have been listed (or if none present) a RPL_ENDOFBANLIST MUST be sent.

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.RPL_INFO
member.summary: IRC: :[string]

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.RPL_ENDOFINFO
member.summary:
IRC: :End of INFO list
Description: A server responding to an INFO message is required to send all its 'info' in a series of RPL_INFO messages with a RPL_ENDOFINFO reply to indicate the end of the replies.

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.RPL_MOTDSTART
member.summary: IRC: :- [server] Message of the day -

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.RPL_MOTD
member.summary: IRC: :- [text]

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.RPL_ENDOFMOTD
member.summary:
IRC: :End of MOTD command
Description: When responding to the MOTD message and the MOTD file is found, the file is displayed line by line, with each line no longer than 80 characters, using RPL_MOTD format replies. These MUST be surrounded by a RPL_MOTDSTART (before the RPL_MOTDs) and an RPL_ENDOFMOTD (after).

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.RPL_YOUREOPER
member.summary:
IRC: :You are now an IRC operator
Description: RPL_YOUREOPER is sent back to a client which has just successfully issued an OPER message and gained operator status.

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.RPL_REHASHING
member.summary:
IRC: [config file] :Rehashing
Description: If the REHASH option is used and an operator sends a REHASH message, an RPL_REHASHING is sent back to the operator.

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.RPL_YOURESERVICE
member.summary:
IRC: You are service [servicename]
Description: Sent by the server to a service upon successful registration.

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.RPL_TIME
member.summary:
IRC: [server] :[string showing server's local time]
Description: When replying to the TIME message, a server MUST send the reply using the RPL_TIME format above. The string showing the time need only contain the correct day and time there. There is no further requirement for the time string.

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.RPL_USERSSTART
member.summary: IRC: :UserID Terminal Host

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.RPL_USERS
member.summary: IRC: :[username] [ttyline] [hostname]

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.RPL_ENDOFUSERS
member.summary: IRC: :End of users

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.RPL_NOUSERS
member.summary:
IRC: :Nobody logged in
Description: If the USERS message is handled by a server, the replies RPL_USERSTART, RPL_USERS, RPL_ENDOFUSERS and RPL_NOUSERS are used. RPL_USERSSTART MUST be sent first, following by either a sequence of RPL_USERS or a single RPL_NOUSER. Following this is RPL_ENDOFUSERS.

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.RPL_TRACELINK
member.summary: IRC: Link [version and debug level] [destination [next server] V[protocol version [link uptime in seconds] [backstream sendq [upstream sendq]

member.summary: IRC: Oper [class] [nick]

member.summary: IRC: Service [class] [name] [type] [active type]

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.RPL_TRACENEWTYPE
member.summary: IRC: [newtype] 0 [client name]

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.RPL_TRACECLASS
member.summary: IRC: Class [class] [count]

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.RPL_TRACERECONNECT
member.summary: IRC: Class [class] [count] Unused

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.RPL_TRACELOG
member.summary: IRC: File [logfile] [debug level]

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.RPL_TRACEEND
member.summary:
IRC: [server name] [version and debug level] :End of TRACE
Description: The RPL_TRACE are all returned by the server in response to the TRACE message. How many are returned is dependent on the TRACE message and whether it was sent by an operator or not. There is no predefined order for which occurs first. Replies RPL_TRACEUNKNOWN, RPL_TRACECONNECTING and RPL_TRACEHANDSHAKE are all used for connections which have not been fully established and are either unknown, still attempting to connect or in the process of completing the 'server handshake'. RPL_TRACELINK is sent by any server which handles a TRACE message and has to pass it on to another server. The list of RPL_TRACELINKs sent in response to a TRACE command traversing the IRC network should reflect the actual connectivity of the servers themselves along that path. RPL_TRACENEWTYPE is to be used for any connection which does not fit in the other categories but is being displayed anyway. RPL_TRACEEND is sent to indicate the end of the list.

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.RPL_STATSLINKINFO
member.summary:
IRC: [linkname] [sendq] [sent messages [sent Kbytes] [received messages [received Kbytes] [time open]
Description: reports statistics on a connection. [linkname] identifies the particular connection, [sendq] is the amount of data that is queued and waiting to be sent [sent messages] the number of messages sent, and [sent Kbytes] the amount of data sent, in Kbytes. [received messages] and [received Kbytes] are the equivalent of [sent messages] and [sent Kbytes] for received data, respectively. [time open] indicates how long ago the connection was opened, in seconds.

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.RPL_STATSCOMMANDS
member.summary:
IRC: [command] [count] [byte count] [remote count]
Description: reports statistics on commands usage.

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.RPL_ENDOFSTATS
member.summary: IRC: [stats letter] :End of STATS report

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.RPL_STATSUPTIME
member.summary:
IRC: :Server Up %d days %d:%02d:%02d
Description: reports the server uptime.

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.RPL_STATSOLINE

Description: reports the allowed hosts from where user may become IRC operators.

Description: To answer a query about a client's own mode, RPL_UMODEIS is sent back.

member.summary:
IRC: :I have [integer] clients and [integer servers
Description: In processing an LUSERS message, the server sends a set of replies from RPL_LUSERCLIENT, RPL_LUSEROP, RPL_USERUNKNOWN, RPL_LUSERCHANNELS and RPL_LUSERME. When replying, a server MUST send back and RPL_LUSERME. The other replies are only sent back if a non-zero count is found for them.

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.RPL_ADMINME
member.summary: IRC: [server] :Administrative info

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.RPL_ADMINLOC1
member.summary: IRC: :[admin info]

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.RPL_ADMINLOC2
member.summary: IRC: :[admin info]

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.RPL_ADMINEMAIL
member.summary:
IRC: :[admin info]
Description: When replying to an ADMIN message, a server is expected to use replies RPL_ADMINME through to RPL_ADMINEMAIL and provide a text message with each. For RPL_ADMINLOC1 a description of what city, state and country the server is in is expected, followed by details of the institution (RPL_ADMINLOC2) and constly the administrative contact for the server (an email address here is REQUIRED) in RPL_ADMINEMAIL.

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.RPL_TRYAGAIN
member.summary:
IRC: [command] :Please wait a while and try again.
Description: When a server drops a command without processing it, it MUST use the reply RPL_TRYAGAIN to inform the originating client.

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.ERR_NOSUCHNICK
member.summary:
IRC: [nickname] :No such nick/channel
Description: Used to indicate the nickname parameter supplied to a command is currently unused.

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.ERR_NOSUCHSERVER
member.summary:
IRC: [server name] :No such server
Description: Used to indicate the server name given currently does not exist.

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.ERR_NOSUCHCHANNEL
member.summary:
IRC: [channel name] :No such channel
Description: Used to indicate the given channel name is invalid.

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.ERR_CANNOTSENDTOCHAN
member.summary:
IRC: [channel name] :Cannot send to channel
Description: Sent to a user who is either (a) not on a channel which is mode +n or (b) not a chanop (or mode +v) on a channel which has mode +m set or where the user is banned and is trying to send a PRIVMSG message to that channel.

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.ERR_TOOMANYCHANNELS
member.summary:
IRC: [channel name] :You have joined too many channels
Description: Sent to a user when they have joined the maximum number of allowed channels and they try to join another channel.

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.ERR_WASNOSUCHNICK
member.summary:
IRC: [nickname] :There was no such nickname
Description: Returned by WHOWAS to indicate there is no history information for that nickname.

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.ERR_TOOMANYTARGETS
member.summary:
IRC: [target] :[error code] recipients. [abort message]
Description: Returned to a client which is attempting to send a PRIVMSG/NOTICE using the user@host destination format and for a user@host which has several occurrences. Returned to a client which trying to send a PRIVMSG/NOTICE to too many recipients. Returned to a client which is attempting to JOIN a safe channel using the shortname when there are more than one such channel.

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.ERR_NOSUCHSERVICE
member.summary:
IRC: [service name] :No such service
Description: Returned to a client which is attempting to send a SQUERY to a service which does not exist.

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.ERR_NOORIGIN
member.summary:
IRC: :No origin specified
Description: PING or PONG message missing the originator parameter.

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.ERR_NORECIPIENT
member.summary: IRC: :No recipient given ([command])

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.ERR_NOTEXTTOSEND
member.summary: IRC: :No text to send

member.summary: IRC: [mask] :No toplevel domain specified

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.ERR_WILDTOPLEVEL
member.summary: IRC: [mask] :Wildcard in toplevel domain

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.ERR_BADMASK
member.summary:
IRC: PRIVMSG $[server]" or "PRIVMSG #[host]" is attempted
Description: 412 - 415 are returned by PRIVMSG to indicate that the message wasn't delivered for some reason. ERR_NOTOPLEVEL and ERR_WILDTOPLEVEL are errors that are returned when an invalid use of

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.ERR_TOOMANYLINES
member.summary: A query returned too many results. This is not an offical part of the RFC but added since it seems to be in use.

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.ERR_UNKNOWNCOMMAND
member.summary:
IRC: [command] :Unknown command
Description: Returned to a registered client to indicate that the command sent is unknown by the server.

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.ERR_NOMOTD
member.summary:
IRC: :MOTD File is missing
Description: Server's MOTD file could not be opened by the server.

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.ERR_NOADMININFO
member.summary:
IRC: [server] :No administrative info available
Description: Returned by a server in response to an ADMIN message when there is an error in finding the appropriate information.

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.ERR_FILEERROR
member.summary:
IRC: :File error doing [file op] on [file]
Description: Generic error message used to report a failed file operation during the processing of a message.

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.ERR_NONICKNAMEGIVEN
member.summary:
IRC: :No nickname given
Description: Returned when a nickname parameter expected for a command and isn't found.

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.ERR_ERRONEUSNICKNAME
member.summary:
IRC: [nick] :Erroneous nickname
Description: Returned after receiving a NICK message which contains characters which do not fall in the defined set. See section 2.3.1 for details on valid nicknames.

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.ERR_NICKNAMEINUSE
member.summary:
IRC: [nick] :Nickname is already in use
Description: Returned when a NICK message is processed that results in an attempt to change to a currently existing nickname.

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.ERR_NICKCOLLISION
member.summary:
IRC: [nick] :Nickname collision KILL from [user]@[host]
Description: Returned by a server to a client when it detects a nickname collision (registered of a NICK that already exists by another server).

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.ERR_UNAVAILRESOURCE
member.summary:
IRC: [nick/channel] :Nick/channel is temporarily unavailable
Description: Returned by a server to a user trying to join a channel currently blocked by the channel delay mechanism. Returned by a server to a user trying to change nickname when the desired nickname is blocked by the nick delay mechanism.

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.ERR_USERNOTINCHANNEL
member.summary:
IRC: [nick] [channel] :They aren't on that channel
Description: Returned by the server to indicate that the target user of the command is not on the given channel.

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.ERR_NOTONCHANNEL
member.summary:
IRC: [channel] :You're not on that channel
Description: Returned by the server whenever a client tries to perform a channel affecting command for which the client isn't a member.

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.ERR_USERONCHANNEL
member.summary:
IRC: [user] [channel] :is already on channel
Description: Returned when a client tries to invite a user to a channel they are already on.

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.ERR_NOLOGIN
member.summary:
IRC: [user] :User not logged in
Description: Returned by the summon after a SUMMON command for a user was unable to be performed since they were not logged in.

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.ERR_SUMMONDISABLED
member.summary:
IRC: :SUMMON has been disabled
Description: Returned as a response to the SUMMON command. MUST be returned by any server which doesn't implement it.

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.ERR_USERSDISABLED
member.summary:
IRC: :USERS has been disabled
Description: Returned as a response to the USERS command. MUST be returned by any server which does not implement it.

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.ERR_NOTREGISTERED
member.summary:
IRC: :You have not registered
Description: Returned by the server to indicate that the client MUST be registered before the server will allow it to be parsed in detail.

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.ERR_NEEDMOREPARAMS
member.summary:
IRC: [command] :Not enough parameters
Description: Returned by the server by numerous commands to indicate to the client that it didn't supply enough parameters.

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.ERR_ALREADYREGISTRED
member.summary:
IRC: :Unauthorized command (already registered)
Description: Returned by the server to any link which tries to change part of the registered details (such as password or user details from second USER message).

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.ERR_NOPERMFORHOST
member.summary:
IRC: :Your host isn't among the privileged
Description: Returned to a client which attempts to register with a server which does not been setup to allow connections from the host the attempted connection is tried.

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.ERR_PASSWDMISMATCH
member.summary:
IRC: :Password incorrect
Description: Returned to indicate a failed attempt at registering a connection for which a password was required and was either not given or incorrect.

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.ERR_YOUREBANNEDCREEP
member.summary:
IRC: :You are banned from this server
Description: Returned after an attempt to connect and register yourself with a server which has been setup to explicitly deny connections to you.

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.ERR_YOUWILLBEBANNED
member.summary:
IRC: :You are banned from this server
Description: Sent by a server to a user to inform that access to the server will soon be denied.

member.summary: IRC: [channel] :Channel key already set

member.summary: IRC: [char] :is unknown mode char to me for [channel]

member.summary: IRC: [channel] :Bad Channel Mask

member.summary: IRC: [channel] :Channel doesn't support modes

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.ERR_BANLISTFULL
member.summary: IRC: [channel] [char] :Channel list is full

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.ERR_NOPRIVILEGES
member.summary:
IRC: :Permission Denied- You're not an IRC operator
Description: Any command requiring operator privileges to operate MUST return this error to indicate the attempt was unsuccessful.

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.ERR_CHANOPRIVSNEEDED
member.summary:
IRC: [channel] :You're not channel operator
Description: Any command requiring 'chanop' privileges (such as MODE messages) MUST return this error if the client making the attempt is not a chanop on the specified channel.

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.ERR_CANTKILLSERVER
member.summary:
IRC: :You can't kill a server!
Description: Any attempts to use the KILL command on a server are to be refused and this error returned directly to the client.

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.ERR_RESTRICTED
member.summary:
IRC: :Your connection is restricted!
Description: Sent by the server to a user upon connection to indicate the restricted nature of the connection (user mode "+r").

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.ERR_UNIQOPPRIVSNEEDED
member.summary:
IRC: :You're not the original channel operator
Description: Any MODE requiring "channel creator" privileges MUST return this error if the client making the attempt is not a chanop on the specified channel.

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.ERR_NOOPERHOST
member.summary:
IRC: :No O-lines for your host
Description: If a client sends an OPER message and the server has not been configured to allow connections from the client's host as an operator, this error MUST be returned.

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.ERR_UMODEUNKNOWNFLAG
member.summary:
IRC: :Unknown MODE flag
Description: Returned by the server to indicate that a MODE message was sent with a nickname parameter and that the a mode flag sent was not recognized.

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.ERR_USERSDONTMATCH
member.summary:
IRC: :Cannot change mode for other users
Description: Error sent to any user trying to view or change the user mode for a user other than themselves.

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.ConnectionFailed
member.summary: When the TCP/IP connection unexpectedly fails.

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.IrcServerError
member.summary: The IRC server sent an 'ERROR' message for some reason.

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.BadDccEndpoint
member.summary: When the socket connection information sent by the remote user in a DCC request is bad.

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.UnparseableMessage
member.summary: A message from the IRC server that cannot be parsed. This may be because the message is intended to cause problems, it may be an unsupported protocol such as DCC Voice, or it may be that the Thresher parser simply cannot understand it.

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.UnableToResume
member.summary: Normally a DCC Resume message is sent in response to a DCC Send. This error is signaled when a DCC Resume message is received without a previous Send or the Send session has timed out.

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.UnknownEncryptionProtocol
member.summary: Signaled when a DCC Get or SEND contains an encryption protocol that Thresher does not support.

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.BadDccAcceptValue
member.summary: When trying to resume a DCC transfer the remote user is supposed to send an Accept message with the same starting position in the file. If these numbers differ this error is raised.

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.BadResumePosition
member.summary: If the remote user sends a DCC resume request which asks for a start position greater than or equals to the file size then this error is raised.

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ReplyCode.DccConnectionRefused
member.summary: When attempting to connect to another machine using DCC and the target machine refuses the connection this error is raised.

member.name: T:Sharkbite.Irc.ChannelMode
member.summary: Possible channel modes.

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ChannelMode.ChannelCreator
member.summary: The mode 'O' is only used in conjunction with "safe channels" and SHALL NOT be manipulated by users. Servers use it to give the user creating the channel the status of "channel creator".

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ChannelMode.ChannelOperator
member.summary:
The mode 'o' is used to toggle the operator status of a channel member.
Should include a nick or user mask parameter.

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ChannelMode.HalfChannelOperator
member.summary:
The mode 'h' is used to toggle the non-standard but common half-operator status of a channel member.
Should include a nick or user mask parameter.

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ChannelMode.Voice
member.summary:
The mode 'v' is used to give and take voice privilege to/from a channel member. Users with this privilege can talk on moderated channels.
Should include a nick or user mask parameter.

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ChannelMode.Anonymous
member.summary:
The channel flag 'a' defines an anonymous channel. This means that when a message sent to the channel is sent by the server to users, and the origin is a user, then it MUST be masked.
No param required.

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ChannelMode.InviteOnly
member.summary:
When the channel flag 'i' is set, new members are only accepted if their mask matches Invite-list or they have been invited by a channel operator. This flag also restricts the usage of the INVITE command to channel operators.
No param required.

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ChannelMode.Moderated
member.summary:
The channel flag 'm' is used to control who may speak on a channel. When it is set, only channel operators, and members who have been given the voice privilege may send messages to the channel.
No param required.

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ChannelMode.NoOutside
member.summary:
When the channel flag 'n' is set, only channel members MAY send messages to the channel.
No param required

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ChannelMode.Quiet
member.summary: The channel flag 'q' is for use by servers only. When set, it restricts the type of data sent to users about the channel operations: other user joins, parts and nick changes are not sent. From a user's point of view, the channel contains only one user.

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ChannelMode.Private
member.summary:
The channel flag 'p' is used to mark a channel "private" and the channel flag 's' to mark a channel "secret". Both properties are similar and conceal the existence of the channel from other users.
No param required.

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ChannelMode.Secret
member.summary:
When a channel is "secret", in addition to the restrictions of Private, the server will act as if the channel does not exist for queries like the TOPIC, LIST, NAMES commands. Note that there is one exception to this rule: servers will correctly reply to the MODE command. Finally, secret channels are not accounted for in the reply to the LUSERS command when the mask parameter is specified.
No param required.

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ChannelMode.ServerReop
member.summary:
The channel flag 'r' is only available on channels which name begins with the character '!' and MAY only be toggled by the "channel creator".
No param required.

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ChannelMode.TopicSettable
member.summary:
The channel flag 't' is used to restrict the usage of the TOPIC command to channel operators.
No param required.

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ChannelMode.Password
member.summary:
When a channel key is set (by using the mode 'k'), servers MUST reject their local users request to join the channel unless this key is given.
Param is the channel password.

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ChannelMode.UserLimit
member.summary:
A user limit may be set on channels by using the channel flag 'l'. When the limit is reached, servers MUST forbid their local users to join the channel.
Param is a whole number indicating the max number of users.

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ChannelMode.Ban
member.summary:
When a user requests to join a channel, his local server checks if the user's address matches any of the ban masks set for the channel. If a match is found, the user request is denied unless the address also matches an exception mask set for the channel.
Param is a nick or user mask.

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ChannelMode.Exception
member.summary: An error ocurred.

member.name: F:Sharkbite.Irc.ChannelMode.Invitation
member.summary:
For channels which have the invite-only flag set, users whose address matches an invitation mask set for the channel are allowed to join the channel without any invitation.
Param is a nick or user mask.

member.name: T:Sharkbite.Irc.NickErrorEventHandler
member.summary: Called when a nick change fails.

remarks.para: This method can be called under 2 conditions: It can arise when the user is already registered with the IRC server and is trying change his nick. Or when the user is trying to register for the first time with the IRC server and it fails.
Note that if the later arises then you will have to manually complete the regsitration process.

member.param: The nick which caused the problem
A message explaining the error

member.name: T:Sharkbite.Irc.NamesEventHandler
member.summary: The response to a request.
member.param: The channel the user is on. "@" is used for secret channels, "*" for private channels, and "=" for public channels.

A list of nicks on the channel. If this is the last reply then it will be empty. Nicks prefixed with a '@' are channel operators. Nicks prefixed with a '+' have voice privileges on a moderated channel, i.e. they are allowed to send public messages.

member.name: P:Sharkbite.Irc.Connection.HandleNickTaken
member.summary: By default the connection itself will handle the case where, while attempting to register the client's nick is already in use. It does this by simply appending 2 random numbers to the end of the nick.
member.remarks: The NickError event is shows that the nick collision has happened and it is fixed by calling Sender's Register() method passing in the replacement nickname.
